The preparation of the Local Anaesthesia:- Combination of 3 drugs used in the local anaesthesia i.e. 1 vial (30 ml) of Inj. Lignocaine with Adrenaline 2%,(1:200000 lacs)+inj Hyaluronidase 1500 I.U. and 1 vial (20 ml) of Inj.Sensurcaine 0.5%.
1. Clean the Eye with betadine lotion and drape the eye with sterile drape.
2. Inject 3ml of Inj Xylocaine with Adrenaline+Inj.
3. Hyaluronidase mixed with 3ml inj sensorcaine 0.5% given by peribulbar route, retrobulbar route and sometime subtenons route.
All team members have introduced themselves by name and role
Types of Intra Occular Lens used during the Cataract Surgery

1. Check for the properly positioning Eye pad, Plastic protective Eye Shields.
 2. To follow the strict aseptic precautions while carrying out any procedure on the eye.
 3. Instructions for Eye drops: 
 1. Head Position: Tilt the head backward and pull the lower eyelid down. Apply one drop of the prescribed E/D medicine. 
 2. Close the eyes immediately to prevent any medication from going into the throat.

3. Close the eye for 10 minutes. 

4. Wipe the excessive medication immediately with clean tissue or sterile cotton pad. 

5. Keep a gap 15 minutes before applying next medication. 

6. Never miss the prescribed medication. 

7. Once opened the eye drops are discarded after 1 month. 

8. Replace the cap of the eye drops immediately after the use. 

9. Make sure that the right eye drops being used for the right number of times. 
 10. If the similar medication is advised for the both eyes, itvis advisable to have separate eye drops for the two eyes. 

11. Unused eye medications once opened is discarded and never used for other patients.

1. Do not rub the eyes for at least 15 days after surgery.
 2. Do not allow the eye to get injured.
 3. Avoid too many visitors for the fear of contacting infection, especially those suffering from cold and conjunctivitis.
 4. Do not play with children since there's a possibility of getting hurt in the eye.

5. Avoid the snuffing, smoking, consumption of the alcoholic beverages. 

6. Avoid the Hand kerchief to mop the eyes always use sterile tissue only. (Strictly single use only) 

7. Never touch the tip of the dropper with bare hands nor it should come in contact with any object, aa this might increase the risk of operation. 

8. Not to strain the eye with near work like reading/writing/watching Television and the Mobile. 

9. Do not remove the protective eye covering unless the surgeon's instructions. Always wear the protective coverings or sun glasses to protect from in the direct contact of the dust and excessive sunlight, also during the night, to sleep with protective eye covering over the eyes, to avoid the rubbing of the eyes. 

10. Avoid the strenuous exercises, aerobics, swimming, cooking, lifting and bending for the first few 3 to 4 weeks. 

11. Regular bath the rest of the body may be taken with care that no water or soap goes into the operated eye. 

12. Avoid sleeping on operated side, put eye shield at time of sleeping for 2 nights after the surgery. 

13. Watering eye should be wiped with tissue paper gently without pressing on the eye. 

14. Sticky and dry discharge also be cleaned with wet wipes(STRIOS Lid wipes). 
 15. Watching TV is permissible from second day provided from a distance and not for more than 30 minutes. 

16. Contact doctors in case of excessive pain or watering.
